snippet: Ukrainian officials on Saturday held more negotiations aimed at ending the country’s political crisis, this time in the region torn by pro-Russian separatism.
abstract: Ukrainian officials hold a second session of negotiations aimed at ending the country's political crisis, this time in the eastern city of Kharkiv, region that has been besieged by pro-Russian separatist violence; no resolution is made, and it is unclear whether talks will continue.

byline.contributor: Daniel Rzhenetskyy contributed reporting from Kiev.

lead_paragraph: Ukrainian officials on Saturday held more negotiations aimed at ending the country’s political crisis, this time in the region torn by pro-Russian separatism.

headline.main: Talks in East Aim to Ease Tensions in Ukraine
headline.print_headline: Talks in East Aim to Ease Tensions in Ukraine
